means: 教友会教徒，教友派信徒

sentence.Network_en: William Penn wrote in the cool, charitable vein of the Quaker faith.
sentence.Network_cn: 威廉·佩恩以较左派冷静宽仁的特性写作.

sentence.Network_en: There was a gentle bustle at the Quaker house, as the afternoon drew to a close.
sentence.Network_cn: 傍晚时分,一个教友会信徒家正在忙个不休.

sentence.Network_en: A Quaker child in an inimical New England settlement is stoned by the other children.
sentence.Network_cn: 一个教友会的孩子,在敌视他的新英格兰村落里,被别的孩子用石头打了.

在那里遇到了Andrew的母亲,一个虔诚的贵格会会员(Quaker)。Andrew的父亲死在奥地利,在那里帮助伤寒患者的时候感染致死。由母亲抚养而大,也是以贵格会的思想教育他的.

according to historical research commissioned by barclays , the book confused a " quaker slave trader " called david barclay with an early bank partner of the same name .巴克莱委托进行的历史研究发现，该书将一个名为戴维巴克莱（davidbarclay）的“教友派奴隶交易者”与该行同名的一位早期合伙人混淆了。

entry.tran: (基督教)贵格会教徒，公谊会教徒，教友会教徒
entry.def: A Quaker is a person who belongs to a Christian group called the Society of Friends.

means.word_mean: 1. one who quakes and trembles with (or as with) fear
